result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Damian Carmona Jr.

records.addlTxt: Court will be down on 12-15-2022.  Court rescheduled plea/sentencing hearing.  Parties notified of new date.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for January 17, 2023 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Damian Carmona Jr. not in court, in custody.  Attorney Sylvan Jaspen appeared by video for Damian Carmona Jr.  Attorney Patrick O'Keefe in court for State of Wisconsin. 
CASE HELD OFF THE RECORD PER JUDGE. Case in court for status conference.  Defense requests a plea/sentencing date.  Court set date as requested.  Case adjourned to Branch 40.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 15, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for LEVEL 5 SUPERVISION.  $1000 cash bond remains on deposit.  All other previously ordered conditions of bail remain in full effect.

Attorney Sylvan Jaspen in court, defendant Damian Carmona not in court, in custody.  Patrick O'Keefe appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for return on warrant.  Arguments heard as to bail.  Court set cash bail.  Case adjourned to Branch 40.  Status conference scheduled for September 20, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Bench warrant cleared by Milwaukee County Sheriff on 8-03-2022.  Original bench warrant scanned.  Case is adjourned until 8-08-2022 at 8:30 am for Return on Bench Warrant in Branch 40.  Notice is given to Public Defenders Office and District Attorney.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE JUDGE ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT.

Attorney Sylvan Jaspen in court.  Patrick O'Keefe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for a plea and sentencing.  Defendant does not appear.  Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued REMAND TO JUDGE. Court takes no action on bail.
Received and Filed: Pretrial Services Supervision Report 4-12-2022
Received and Filed: Pretrial Services Discharge Report 4-12-2022

22RM018140  Actual Date Bond Posted with * Sheriff
4/1/2022
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5. All same terms and conditions.

Attorney Sylvan Jaspen in court, defendant Damian Carmona not in court, in custody.  Patrick O'Keefe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for a bail bond hearing.   Bail motion by defense argued and GRANTED by the Court. Defense requests a plea and sentencing hearing date. Case adjourned to Branch 40.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 21, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Damian Carmona in court with Attorney Sylvan Jaspen; both appear by video.  Defendant Damian Carmona in custody.  Anna Marie Meulbroek appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Officer J. Torres. Court took judicial notice of 21CF4332. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty. Defense to be heard on bail on the next date. Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for March 10, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Court ordered no contact with Lydia Mendez
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.
  The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Damian Carmona in court with attorney Douglas J. Rebholz.  Defendant Damian Carmona in custody.  Thomas Hasle appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   All parties appeared by video conference.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Shelton, Branch 40. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 8, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
